definition: to salute/to make one's salutations

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to perform the ritual bows/to follow the customary ceremonies

sentences.english: Raise the national flag. Play the national anthem. Salute!
sentences.chinese: 升国旗，奏国歌，全体行礼。

sentences.english: The guard saluted the general smartly.
sentences.chinese: 卫兵非常精神地向将军行礼。

sentences.english: He bowed down to the Queen.
In bows and curtsies, it's the lower-status person who indicates that they're going to make a reverence first.
sentences.chinese: 行礼致意时，总由身份低的人，先行一步，表示敬意。

sentences.english: Poulengey salutes, and stands at the door awaiting orders.
sentences.chinese: 波仑日行礼，站在门口听侯命令。

sentences.english: We salute the flag every Monday at school.
sentences.chinese: 我们在学校每周一向国旗行礼。

sentences.english: All the men in the court bowed before the king as he entered.
sentences.chinese: 国王进来时，宫廷里所有人都向他躬身行礼。

sentences.english: Now you bow and I curtsy.
Head suddenly come to a man robbed Amys salute box.
sentences.chinese: 迎面忽然过来一中年男子抢走了艾米的行礼箱。
安塔芮丝人卫兵向他鞠躬行礼。

sentences.english: We salute the flag everyday at school.
sentences.chinese: 我们在学校每天向国旗行礼。

sentences.english: These days, we realize that the salute itself is the motions and the words.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们明白，行礼是动作加言词。

sentences.english: Recognizing the Regent's chief scientist, they immediately genuflected and offered their salute.
sentences.chinese: 他们认出了瑞金特的首席科学家，立刻跪地行礼致敬。

sentences.english: And all your sheaves came around it and bowed down to my sheaf.
sentences.chinese: 而你们的几捆则过来站在它周围对它鞠躬行礼。

sentences.english: Former Swiss Guards salute in the Castelgrande in Bellinzona, southern Switzerland, April 6, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 前任瑞士卫队在南瑞士贝林索纳的大城堡行礼。

definition: to salute/to greet
to bow
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
deferential/respectful
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to kneel down
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to bow with hands held in front
reverent and respectful/extremely deferential
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
